author: Lukesh Pillaii
title: Compelling Content Marketing for Large Enterprises: A Comprehensive Guide to Strategy, Execution, and Growth
content:
Content marketing for large enterprises is now a fundamental part of practically every business globally. In big companies, the effect is exponentially significant, bringing benefits like more extensive financing, scale, and a larger audience base. However, it also presents specific challenges, including homogeneity, working with a vast team, and creating value at a large scale. This guide explains how big businesses can improve their image and sales through content marketing for large enterprises and discusses tactics that yield enduring results.

Why Content Marketing is Vital for Large Enterprises

As with every other marketing strategy, content marketing has some potential benefits to give to large enterprises, especially in areas where markets can be highly competitive: It helps establish trust and credibility with audiences. Content marketing stands in contrast to traditional advertising because the goal is to deliver ongoing value through information, analysis, and fun. A good strategy brings customers in, builds relationships and makes the brand stand out. For those not privy to the current trends, the firm deltas have shifted content marketing from the “nice to have” to the “must have” to the firm that wants sustainable customer growth in this new consumer and digital age.

Defining the Goals of a Content Marketing Strategy

Defining goals is necessary for content marketing regardless of the company’s size, but it is essential for large companies. Having put down what the enterprise wants out of it—more brand exposure, website traffic, or consumer consumer interactions – there is a good beginning. Larger goals mean that goals can be quantifiable, or one can enhance their measuring properties to make content efforts tangible and link them directly to what the business aims to achieve.

Establishing Measurable Objectives

Large enterprises should, therefore, set SMART goals that include Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound aspects. Likes should consist of short-term mileposts and long-term goals. Some common objectives include:

  • Generating at least a specific percentage point increases web traffic within a quarter.
  • Increasing number of visits and click-through rates on social media platforms.
  • Creating a fixed amount of leads or conversions every month.

It makes teams’ efforts quite focused and concrete since it measures delegation and ensures techniques get amended due to the pace of business advancement.

Understanding the Large-Scale Audience

The most crucial factor in any content marketing initiative is audience understanding. For large enterprises, this means dividing audiences relying on demographic data, preferences, and behavioural patterns. Audience segmentation allows an organization to target different content to different people, which is more well-received and improves results.

The critical step in market analysis is making a comprehensive market analysis.

Market analysis helps enterprises understand their customers/audience, know their competitors, and learn new trends. Hence, the target group’s demographics and content consumption preferences can be beneficial in creating content that enterprises will take time to develop to meet the people’s needs.

Building Buyer Personas

A buyer persona is also a consumer archetype; it describes a perfect buyer, including his age, job title/challenges, and goals. In large and small enterprises, there may be several personas in different geographical locations and product segments, so content needs to be tailored appropriately for each group.

Building a Dedicated Content Team

Successful content marketing in large enterprises requires a skilled, well-structured team. Unlike smaller businesses, where a few people might wear many hats, large enterprises need specialized roles to manage the diverse needs of content creation, distribution, and measurement.

Key Roles in a Content Team

  1. Content Strategist: Responsible for defining the content vision, goals, and types.
  2. Writers and Editors: Craft and refine content to align with brand messaging and quality standards.
  3. Designers: Enhance the visual appeal of content through images, infographics, and layouts.
  4. SEO Specialists: Optimize content for search engines to increase visibility.
  5. Content Marketers: Distribute and promote content across platforms.

Promoting Cross-Departmental Collaboration

Collaboration across departments, such as sales, customer service, and product teams, ensures that content reflects diverse insights and caters to customer needs. Regular cross-departmental meetings and feedback sessions can align messaging and enrich the content with perspectives that deepen relevance and value.

Developing a Robust Content Strategy

A robust content strategy serves as the roadmap for content creation and distribution. This includes setting guidelines on messaging, tone, and topics for large enterprises to create a consistent brand voice across channels.

Content Types to Focus On

  1. Blogs and Articles: Written content positions the brand as an industry expert, drives SEO traffic, and provides valuable information to the audience.
  2. Video Content: Engaging, easily consumable, and excellent for storytelling, videos are ideal for sharing product demos, customer stories, or behind-the-scenes glimpses.
  3. Infographics: Great for presenting data in an easily digestible format, infographics are highly shareable and simplify complex information.
  4. Podcasts and Webinars: These formats allow deeper dives into topics, positioning the brand as a thought leader and building a loyal audience.

The Power of a Content Calendar

A content calendar is essential for managing a steady content flow, ensuring consistency, and aligning with company campaigns or product launches. A well-organized content calendar outlines publishing dates, formats, topics, and channels, keeping the team aligned and proactive.

Benefits of a Content Calendar

  • Consistency: Regular posting builds trust with the audience and enhances SEO.
  • Organization: Keeps track of upcoming content, deadlines, and critical events.
  • Alignment: Ensures all content supports broader business goals and campaigns.

Optimizing Content for SEO and Engagement

SEO and engagement optimization are critical for visibility and audience retention. Large enterprises should leverage their resources to create highly discoverable and engaging content.

Best Practices for SEO Optimization

  1. Keyword Research: Identify keywords that resonate with target personas.
  2. Meta Descriptions: Craft compelling meta descriptions that encourage clicks.
  3. Internal and External Linking: Boosts SEO while providing the audience with further information.

Engagement Optimization Tips

  • Interactive Elements: Polls, quizzes, and graphics can keep audiences engaged longer.
  • Personalization: Personalized recommendations or content adjustments based on audience behaviour improve relevance.
  • Clear Calls-to-Action (CTAs): Direct CTAs encourage the audience to take the next step, whether it’s subscribing, commenting, or sharing.

Leveraging Analytics to Guide Strategy

Data analytics is invaluable for large enterprises, helping identify what resonates with the audience and where improvements are needed. Regularly analyzing metrics like engagement, bounce, and conversion rates can inform future content.

Important Content Metrics

  • Engagement Metrics: Measures likes, shares, and comments, providing insight into audience interest.
  • Conversion Rates: Tracks actions taken by the audience after interacting with the content.
  • Customer Retention: Measures the percentage of returning visitors, indicating sustained interest.

Distributing Content Across Multiple Channels

Content distribution involves sharing content across platforms where the target audience is most active. For large enterprises, a multichannel approach maximizes reach and effectiveness.

Key Channels for Distribution

  1. Social Media: Platforms like LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter help reach diverse audience segments.
  2. Email Newsletters: Direct and personal emails allow enterprises to keep their audience informed regularly.
  3. Third-Party Platforms: Industry sites, forums, and media partnerships extend reach to audiences beyond the brand’s owned channels.

Balancing Paid and Organic Strategies

A combination of paid and organic strategies optimizes visibility. Organic efforts, like blog posts and social shares, build trust and authority, while paid strategies, such as sponsored content and targeted ads, provide faster reach and brand amplification.

Establishing Scalable Content Processes

Scalability is crucial for large enterprises to adapt to increasing content needs. By establishing efficient workflows, automation, and standardization, enterprises can manage high-volume content production without compromising quality.

Measuring Success and Refining the Strategy

Constant evaluation of content performance ensures that the strategy remains relevant and practical. Large enterprises should make iterative adjustments to align with shifting customer preferences, industry trends, and organizational goals.

Conclusion

Creating a successful content marketing strategy for large enterprises involves clearly understanding goals, audience, and available resources. From market analysis and cross-departmental collaboration to content optimization and distribution, each aspect requires careful consideration to ensure scalable, effective content marketing. With clear objectives, strategic planning, and continuous adaptation, large enterprises can create a robust content marketing engine that builds brand value and drives lasting success.
description: Content marketing for large enterprises is now a fundamental part of practically every business globally. In big companies, the effect is exponentially significant, bringing benefits like more extensive financing, scale, and a larger audience base. However, it also presents specific challenges, including homogeneity, working with a vast team, and creating value at a large scale….

author: Lukesh Pillaii
title: SEO Malaysia: All you need to know
content:
SEO is one of the most important aspects of digital marketing for businesses today.

SEO specialists are in high demand and Malaysia is no exception. SEO Specialist Malaysia 101 – All the Basics You Need to Know will help you understand what SEO is, why it’s so important and how to find an SEO specialist that fits your business needs. This guide will also provide information on key SEO strategies, tips for success and common mistakes to avoid when working with an SEO specialist in Malaysia. Read on to learn more about search engine optimization (SEO) in Malaysia!

What is SEO?

SEO stands for search engine optimization and it is the process of optimizing web pages, content, images and other elements of a website to rank higher in search engine results. SEO helps businesses reach their target audiences more quickly and effectively by improving visibility on search engines such as Google, Bing and Yahoo. SEO specialists use various methods to improve a website’s rankings in organic search engine results, including keyword research, page optimization, link building and content creation.

Why is SEO Important?

SEO is essential for any business looking to succeed online. By optimizing your website for relevant searches, you can increase your visibility in organic search results which will drive more traffic to your site. This increased traffic can lead to higher conversions rates as well as better brand awareness and recognition. SEO also helps you build a stronger online reputation, which can result in better customer loyalty and higher engagement rates.

Finding an SEO Specialist in Malaysia

Finding the right SEO specialist for your business is essential. You should look for someone with extensive experience in SEO who understands both local and international markets as well as your industry’s specific needs. The ideal SEO specialist should have strong communication skills, be up to date on the latest SEO trends, and have a proven track record of successful SEO campaigns. Additionally, they should be able to provide clear reporting so that you can easily measure their effectiveness.

Key SEO Strategies

Once you have found the right SEO specialist for your business, it’s time to explore key SEO strategies. SEO specialists will typically focus on three main areas: content optimization, link building and technical SEO. Content optimization involves optimizing existing website content to make it more relevant to target keywords and phrases. Link building focuses on creating high-quality inbound links from other websites to your own, while technical SEO includes optimization of the website’s coding structure, page speed and crawlability to improve search engine rankings.

Success Tips for SEO in Malaysia

In order to ensure successful SEO campaigns in Malaysia, there are several tips you should keep in mind. First, create a comprehensive SEO strategy that takes into account both short-term and long-term goals. Additionally, be sure to track your progress regularly so that you can adjust your SEO strategy as needed. Finally, stay up to date on the latest SEO trends and changes in search engine algorithms to ensure that you’re always one step ahead of your competitors.

Common SEO Mistakes to Avoid

SEO can be a tricky business, so it’s important to avoid common mistakes like keyword stuffing and link spamming. Additionally, be sure to focus on quality over quantity when optimizing content for SEO. Finally, don’t forget about mobile optimization – with more and more people accessing the web from their phones, it is essential that your website looks great no matter what device they are using.

Conclusion

With this knowledge, you now have the tools needed to help optimize your website for SEO success. With proper implementation of SEO techniques, Malaysia businesses can enjoy higher rankings in search engine results pages and increased visibility online which leads to better brand recognition, more customer loyalty, and higher conversion rates. SEO is an essential part of any digital marketing strategy and when done correctly, it can provide your business with a competitive edge. By finding the right SEO specialist and staying on top of the latest SEO trends, you can ensure that your SEO campaigns are successful and effective. Best of luck!

This blog post was written to provide readers with all the basics they need to know about SEO Specialist Malaysia 101. Through understanding key SEO strategies, avoiding common mistakes, using up-to-date SEO trends and practices, businesses in Malaysia can ensure that their SEO efforts will be successful and lead to increased visibility online which leads to better brand recognition, higher customer loyalty, and higher conversion rates. SEO is an essential part of any digital marketing strategy and understanding how to use SEO correctly can help businesses in Malaysia gain a competitive edge. By finding the right SEO specialist, staying up to date on SEO trends, and avoiding common SEO mistakes, businesses can ensure that their SEO campaigns will be successful and effective. Good luck!

author: Lukesh Pillaii
title: SEO versus SEM: Which Should You Utilize?
content:
Search engine optimization (SEO) and search engine marketing (SEM) are two of the most important strategies for driving organic traffic to your website.

SEO is about optimizing your website for better visibility in organic search results, while SEM focuses on paid advertising through Google Ads or other platforms. SEO and SEM can both be effective tools when it comes to growing your business online, but they have different advantages and disadvantages that need to be weighed against each other before deciding which one is right for you. In this blog post, we will explore SEO vs. SEM: which one should you use?

First, let’s look at SEO.

SEO is the practice of optimizing your website so it can be found more easily in organic search engine results. SEO involves optimizing content and building links to increase your site’s authority, which helps you appear higher in the search rankings. SEO also helps ensure that users are able to find what they are looking for on your website. SEO can be an effective way to drive organic traffic to your site, but it takes time and effort and requires ongoing maintenance if you want to see the best results.

Now, let’s look at SEM.

SEM is a form of paid advertising through Google Ads or other platforms where advertisers bid on certain keywords related to their products or services in order to display their ads in search engine results. This type of advertising is generally more expensive than SEO, but it can be much faster and more effective at driving targeted traffic to your website. The key with SEM is making sure that you are targeting the right keywords for your business in order to maximize conversions from visitors to customers.

So which one should you use? Ultimately, SEO and SEM both have their advantages and disadvantages, so there is no single answer as to which one is best for you.

SEO can be a great way to drive organic traffic over time, but it takes effort and commitment to get the best results. On the other hand, SEM can deliver highly targeted traffic quickly, but it can also be costly if not done correctly. Depending on your business, budget and goals, SEO or SEM may be more suitable for you. It is important to carefully weigh your options and consider the pros and cons of each before deciding which one is right for you.

SEO can be a great way to build organic traffic over time and improve your search engine rankings, while SEM offers highly targeted traffic quickly but can also come at a cost. No matter which option you choose, it’s important to make sure that your SEO and SEM strategies are aligned with each other in order to get the best results for your business.

SEO is a strategy for organic search.

SEM is a tactic for paid search.

SEM Constructs on Your SEO Foundation and Boosts Results

Search engine marketing (SEM) is the practice of using paid advertisements on search engines to boost a website’s exposure and traffic. However, it is not as easy as drafting an advertisement and bidding on keywords. Ad copy and targeting methods must coincide with keywords that correspond to the search queries of target customers, so that advertising appear for the right people at the right time, in relevant SERPs.

Utilizing paid advertisements strategically provides an opportunity to boost the visibility of specific web pages, landing pages, blog entries, and other essential information. Therefore, a marketer using SEM must utilize both SEO and pay-per-click (PPC) advertisements to target potential clients and generate traffic.

SEO becomes an integral part of a SEM strategy.

Which Strategy Is More Effective, SEO or SEM?

It should now be obvious that this is a trick question. You are aware that SEO is a fundamental component of SEM. You cannot achieve effective SEM results without a rigorous SEO practice. They are neither comparable nor interchangeable; they are complementary.

Make SEO your first priority.

SEO creates the framework for SEM by optimizing content that is beneficial to your consumers and prospects. Without landing pages, web pages, and blog content that are all search engine optimized, SEM efforts fail due to their lack of quality. This makes it considerably more difficult to get prominence on search engine results sites. And this can result in a squandered SEM budget.

Organic SEO helps develop search credibility, but the most essential core focus must be regularly producing high-quality content that is worth searching for in the first place — and then distributing it via social media and other content distribution and promotion channels.

WHEN TO FOCUS ON SEM

There are a few really important use cases that require quick search visibility, such as the launch of a new product or service or a new website for a company with no current online footprint. Prior to establishing organic credibility, SEM is a useful tool. A targeted PPC strategy can provide the traffic necessary to build a stronger online presence more quickly.

Conclusion

Make sure you and your digital marketing team thoroughly comprehend the distinctions between SEM and SEO. In addition, plan ahead for ongoing content optimization and improvement.

Receive an easy-to-understand introduction to SEO fundamentals and beyond, at your convenience. Simply click on the link to gain access to the webinar, Demystifying Search Engine Optimization, and begin constructing your search marketing strategy with confidence.

Hope this helps!

author: Lukesh Pillaii
title: How long does it take for SEO Malaysia to become effective in 2023?
content:
As we enter into the new year of 2023, many businesses are wondering how long it will take for their SEO efforts to start paying off.

The truth is that there is no universal answer to this question as every business and website is unique and results can vary greatly from one case to another.

However, by understanding some key principles about SEO and its impact on search engine rankings, you can get a better idea of what kind of timeline you should expect when working with an SEO expert in 2023.

In this blog post, we’ll look at the factors that affect how quickly your SEO efforts will begin producing results as well as tips for getting started with an effective SEO strategy in the new year.

To start, it’s important to understand that SEO is an ongoing process and not a quick fix.

It can take months or even years for your website to gain traction in the search engine rankings, depending on the industry you’re in and the competition level.

Additionally, since SEO involves both on-page optimization like optimizing titles and meta descriptions as well as off-page activities such as link building, there are multiple steps involved in achieving success.

This means that results may not be noticeable until several months have passed.

Another factor to consider when determining how long SEO will take to start working is the current state of your website.

If you already have an established web presence but aren’t getting much traffic from organic search engines, then it may take slightly less time for your efforts to begin paying off.

On the other hand, if you’re starting from scratch with a new website that has no previous history or presence online, it can take much longer for your SEO strategies to start producing results.

Finally, the quality of backlinks and content on your site will also play an important role in how quickly SEO starts working for you.

Quality links from reputable websites are essential for improving search engine visibility and ranking high in the SERPs.

Similarly, creating high-quality content that provides real value to readers is key for engaging visitors and building trust with search engines. Investing the time and resources into creating quality content and finding good link opportunities can go a long way towards speeding up the SEO process and helping you to achieve your goals in the new year.

Conclusion

How Long Does SEO Take To Start Working In 2023? varies greatly depending on a range of factors such as your industry, website quality, competition level and backlink profile.

However, by following the tips outlined above and investing time into creating quality content and link building opportunities, you can start seeing results from your SEO efforts within a few months or even sooner.

With this knowledge in hand, you’ll be well-equipped to start off the new year with an effective SEO strategy that will bring success to your business in 2023.

title: 20 SEO Tips You Need To Know and Apply
content:
20 SEO Tips You Need To Know and Apply

Search engine optimization (SEO) is a key factor for any online business to succeed.

With the right SEO strategy, you can get more organic traffic, higher rankings in SERP results and ultimately more conversions.

However, it’s not enough just to create content and hope that people will find it. You need an effective SEO strategy that takes into account all aspects of your website and its ranking performance in order to maximize visibility in SERP results over time.

In this article we will look at 20 tips for an effective SEO strategy that can help you improve your website’s ranking performance over time. From optimizing images and leveraging structured data markup to submitting sitemaps and taking advantage of social media channels; these tips are designed to help you get ahead of the competition by improving your overall SEO success.

1. Research Your Target Keywords

Ensure that you choose relevant keywords for your small business website.

2. Optimize Page Titles and Meta Descriptions

Creating optimized page titles and meta descriptions will help search engine users understand what type of content your pages offer.

3. Write Quality Content That Is Relevant To Your Niche

Quality content is essential for SEO success, as it helps send signals to search engines that your pages are valuable resources on the topic they cover.

4. Add Structured Data Markup to Your Site’s Pages

Structured data markup can help search engines better understand the context of your site’s content, leading to improved visibility in SERPs over time.

5. Create Internal Links Between Pages On Your Website

Utilizing internal links between different pages on your website is one of the easiest ways to improve its overall ranking power with search engines like Google and Bing

6. Speed Up Slow Loading Pages

Long loading times have a significant negative impact on user experience, which can lead to decreased rankings in SERP results due to their relevance algorithm updates such as Mobile-First Indexing or Core Web Vitals Update 2021 .

7 Check For Crawl Errors With Google Search Console

Utilizing Google Search Console to monitor crawl errors is essential for improving SEO performance, as it allows you quickly identify and fix any potential issues.

8. Track Your Progress With Google Analytics

Tracking your progress with Google Analytics can help you understand which tactics are working best and adjust your strategy accordingly.

9. Monitor Backlinks And Remove Bad Links

Link building is an important part of SEO, but it’s also important to ensure that the links pointing back to your website are from quality sources. Regularly monitoring backlinks and removing bad links will help prevent any damage to your site’s rankings over time.

10. Optimize For Local Searches

If your small business serves customers in a specific area , optimizing your website for local searches can help you boost its visibility. Utilizing local listing sites such as Google My Business and Bing Places, as well as creating content that focuses on the areas served by your business are essential for increased rankings in the SERPs.

11. Monitor Your Competitors’ SEO Performance

Keeping an eye on what your competitors are doing with their SEO campaigns will give you valuable insights into how to better optimize yours. Tracking keyword performance and analyzing backlinks can help you get a competitive edge over other businesses in your niche.

12. Integrate Social Media Into Your Strategy

Social media is becoming increasingly important to SEO success. By integrating social media channels like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram into your overall digital marketing strategy, you can help drive more traffic to your website, boost brand awareness and improve search engine rankings.

13. Take Advantage of Image Optimization

Images are an important part of SEO success, so make sure you take advantage of them with proper optimization. Utilizing descriptive ALT tags, as well as compressing images to reduce their file size can help increase the visibility of your pages in SERP results over time.

14. Monitor Your Rankings

Regularly monitoring your website’s ranking performance will allow you to quickly identify any potential issues and correct them before they have a major impact on your overall SEO success. Using tools like Google Analytics or Moz’s Keyword Explorer can help you track your keyword rankings over time, as well as identify new opportunities to increase visibility.

15. Keep Content Fresh and Up-to-Date

Search engines favor fresh content, so regularly updating your website’s content is important for improving its ranking performance in SERP results over time. Adding new content or making changes to existing pages can help boost the visibility of your site in search engine results.

16. Optimize for Mobile Devices

Since Google’s mobile-first indexing algorithm update, having a mobile-friendly version of your website has become increasingly important for SEO success. Utilizing responsive design and optimizing images and other elements for mobile devices can help you improve the visibility of your website in SERPs over time.

17. Submit Your Sitemap To Search Engines

Submitting your sitemap to major search engines is an important part of SEO that can help increase the visibility of your website in SERPs over time. This process involves using Google’s Webmaster Tools or Bing Webmaster Tools to submit your XML sitemap and make sure it’s being indexed properly by search engine crawlers.

18. Leverage Structured Data Markup

Utilizing structured data markup can help you create a better user experience and boost the visibility of your website in SERP results over time. Structured data markup helps search engines understand intent, context and other elements on each page, making it easier for them to index and display relevant search results.

19. Use Internal Links

Internal links are an important part of SEO that can help boost the visibility and ranking performance of your website in SERPs over time. Utilizing internal linking to create a hierarchy of page importance helps establish authority and relevance for each page on your site, which can help improve SEO performance over time.

20. Utilize Google Search Console

Taking advantage of Google Search Console is an invaluable tool for improving the SEO performance of your website over time. This free service from Google allows you to monitor and analyze indexing, crawling and other optimization issues that may be affecting your website’s visibility in SERP results. Regularly utilizing this tool will help you ensure that all pages.

title: How To Use SEO for your Successful Business Strategy in Malaysia
content:

Digital marketing is becoming increasingly important for companies looking to reach a larger audience and build their brand presence.

With so many different strategies available, it can be hard for businesses to know what works best – especially when trends are changing quickly.

Fortunately, there are certain key points that all Malaysian businesses should consider when planning their digital marketing strategy and SEO success in 2023.

In this blog post, we’ll explore some of these areas and discuss how they can help your business succeed online this year.

To begin with, understanding and utilizing the power of search engine optimization (SEO) is essential for any Malaysian business in 2023.

SEO strategy allows you to attract potential customers by making sure your website appears higher up in online search engine.

This can be achieved through keyword research, content creation, and link building – all of which can help drive more organic traffic to your site.

Additionally, having a mobile-friendly website is also critical for success in today’s digital world.

Social media networks are another powerful tool that Malaysian businesses should consider when developing their digital marketing strategy this year.

Not only can social media help you reach a larger audience, but it also provides an opportunity to interact with customers directly and build relationships.

You can use social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or LinkedIn to share content, engage with followers, and advertise products.

Additionally, experimenting with new tactics such as influencer marketing or paid advertising on social networks can be beneficial for reaching potential customers and growing your business.

Finally, companies in Malaysia should ensure they are staying up-to-date with the latest trends and technology.

Technology is constantly changing and evolving – especially when it comes to digital marketing – so it’s important to stay ahead of the curve.

This could include search engine in new tools or strategies that may benefit your business, as well as testing out different tactics to see what works best.

In conclusion, digital marketing is an essential part of any successful business strategy in Malaysia.

By utilizing the power of SEO success, SEO strategy and social media, developing a mobile-friendly website, and staying up-to-date with the latest trends and technology, your company can remain competitive in 2023.

With these tips in mind, you’ll be well on your way to success this year!

In addition, businesses should also focus on building a strong online presence.

This can be done by creating content that is relevant to your target audience and engaging with customers across various platforms.

Additionally, investing in digital advertising campaigns such as pay-per-click (PPC) or display advertising can help increase visibility and attract potential customers.

Utilizing these strategies will ensure that your business stands out from the crowd and reaches its maximum potential and will lead to SEO success in 2023.

With this comprehensive guide to digital marketing for Malaysian businesses in 2023, you’ll have all the tools like search engine that’s necessary to succeed in the digital world.

By understanding SEO success, utilizing social media networks, optimizing mobile experiences , and keeping up with current trends, you’ll be able to create an effective digital marketing strategy that will help your business thrive this year.

Good luck as you develop and implement your digital marketing strategy and SEO success for 2023!

With the right combination of SEO, social media networking, mobile optimization, and staying up-to-date on the latest technology, you’ll be well on your way to success. Best of luck!

author: Lukesh Pillaii
title: 7 Important Google Ranking Factors For 2023
content:
With the ever-evolving digital landscape, staying ahead of the curve when it comes to SEO is essential for any business looking to remain competitive.

As we move into 2023, Google’s algorithm, Google Search Console and Google search is becoming increasingly sophisticated and requires an even more strategic approach if you want your website to rank well. Although there are many factors that influence a website’s ranking on Google search, here are seven of the most important ones that need to be taken into account in order for your website to succeed in 2023.

1. Focus on Quality Content

Quality content will always be king when it comes to SEO. Make sure that your website contains a variety of high-quality content including text, images, videos and audio clips. This should all be informative and relevant to what users are looking for, as well as being unique and interesting for Google Search Console.

2. Utilize Keywords Effectively

Finding the right keywords is essential if you want your website to rank highly in search engine results pages (SERPs). Knowing which words and phrases people are using to find businesses like yours is key; use tools such as Google search and Google AdWords or other keyword research tools to uncover valuable insights into which terms you should focus on optimizing for.

3. Mobile Optimization

With more and more people using their smartphones to browse the web, it’s essential that your website is optimized for mobile devices in Google Search Console. Make sure everything looks great on smaller screens and remember to optimize content for shorter attention spans.

4. Optimize for Voice Search

Voice search is becoming increasingly popular, with voice assistants such as Siri, Google Home, Google search, Google Search Console and Alexa being used in many households. To ensure your website can appear in voice search results, you need to focus on conversational language when crafting your content.

5. Employ Schema Markup

Structured data (also known as schema markup) helps define how the information on a web page should be understood by search engines like Google and Google search. This allows them to display rich snippets in search engine results pages that can help draw more attention to your website.

6. Utilize Social Media

Social media isn’t just for connecting with friends and family; it also offers great potential for businesses looking to increase their visibility online. Ensure you have active accounts on key platforms such as Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn, and leverage them by regularly sharing content from your website.

7. Monitor Your Progress

Once you’ve implemented the above strategies, it’s important to keep track of your progress. Use tools such as Google Analytics or Moz Pro to monitor changes in rankings, visits, conversions and other important metrics from month-to-month so you can identify which tactics are having the most impact on your success.

Conclusion

By taking the time to focus on these seven aspects of SEO, you can maximize the potential success of your website in 2023 and beyond. Good luck!

author: Lukesh Pillaii
title: 7 Steps to Learn SEO for Free – Learn SEO at Home
content:
Search engine optimization (SEO) is an essential part of any online business.

It helps you to rank higher in search engine results, drive more traffic to your website and ultimately convert more leads into customers. But learning SEO can often be a time-consuming and expensive process for small businesses who don’t have the resources or budget to hire a professional. Fortunately, there are plenty of free resources available that can help you learn SEO from home without breaking the bank. Here are six steps you can take to start learning SEO today – for free!

1. Utilize Google Search Console

Start by signing up for a free Google Search Console account. This will allow you to monitor your website’s performance and make sure that it is indexing correctly in search engine results pages (SERPs).

2. Read SEO blogs

There are plenty of great SEO blogs out there that offer valuable tips and advice on optimizing websites for better ranking results. Make sure to stay up-to-date on the latest industry news and trends – this will ensure that you’re always ahead of the curve!

3. Watch tutorials

YouTube has become an invaluable resource for learning SEO, with tons of free video tutorials available from professionals in the industry. Whether it’s learning the basics of keyword research or mastering the intricacies of link building, you can find a tutorial that’s right for your level and experience.

4. Attend webinars

Many SEO professionals offer free webinars and seminars to help teach their methods and strategies. Take advantage of this opportunity to learn from the experts – it’s a great way to stay informed while picking up insider tips on how to optimize your website.

5. Join an online community

Joining an online SEO community is a great way to connect with other professionals and get feedback on your work in real-time. Not only will you be able to ask questions, but you’ll also have access to valuable resources like tutorials , case studies, and more.

6. Test what you learn

Once you’ve learned some of the basics, it’s important to test out your new skills by implementing them on your own website. Try different tactics and strategies to see what works best for you – as long as you keep track of your results, this will be an invaluable learning experience for improving your website’s SEO performance.

By following these six steps, you can begin to learn SEO from home without breaking the bank. Taking the time to invest in yourself and gaining a better understanding of how search engines work can pay off in the long run by helping your business become more successful online!

7. Understand the goal of SEO

Search engine optimization (SEO) is a crucial part of any online business. It helps you to rank higher in search engine results, drive more traffic to your website and ultimately convert more leads into customers. But before diving deep into SEO tactics and strategies, it’s important to understand the goal of SEO and how it can benefit your business.

Conclusion

Understanding this will give you a better foundation for making informed decisions about how best to optimize your website for improved ranking performance. In this blog post, we’ll take a look at what exactly SEO is, what its goals are, and why it’s so important for businesses today.

author: Lukesh Pillaii
title: SEO Malaysia: All You Need to Know about Technical SEO
content:
Technical SEO is an important part of any successful digital marketing strategy.

As the search engine algorithms become increasingly complex, Technical SEO has become more and more essential for ensuring that your website can be found by potential customers.

The Technical SEO 2022: Ultimate Guide will show you how to optimize your website so it can rank higher in search engine results pages (SERPs). In this guide, we’ll cover topics such as page speed optimization, creating content silos, optimizing meta tags and titles, using structured data markup correctly and much more. We’ll also provide tips on how to stay up-to-date with the latest Technical SEO trends and best practices so you can make sure your website is always optimized for maximum visibility. So let’s dive into Technical SEO 2022: The Ultimate Guide!

Page Speed Optimization

Page speed is one of the most important Technical SEO criteria. A slow loading page not only costs you traffic, but it can also lead to a poor user experience and lower rankings in search engine results pages. To ensure your website loads quickly, you’ll need to optimize image sizes, use a good web hosting provider, and minimize redirects as much as possible.

Creating Content Silos

Creating content silos for better internal linking structure is another essential Technical SEO concept. This will help your website rank higher in SERPs by using keywords correctly and providing users with an organized navigation system that makes it easier for them to find what they’re looking for on your site.

Optimizing Meta Tags and Titles

Technical SEO also involves optimizing meta tags and titles for better search engine visibility. This includes using the right keywords in your title tag, creating a unique description for each page, and making sure you include all relevant information such as the product name or category.

Using Structured Data Markup Correctly

Structured data markup is an important part of Technical SEO because it helps search engines understand what your content is about. By adding this code to your webpages, you can make it easier for search engines to index your content so that more users will find it in SERPs.

Staying Up-to-Date with Technical SEO Trends and Best Practices

Finally, staying up-to-date with Technical SEO trends and best practices is essential for ensuring that your website is always optimized for maximum visibility. This includes regularly reviewing Technical SEO metrics such as page speed, keyword density, and internal link structure to make sure they’re up-to-date. Additionally, you should keep an eye out for any new search engine algorithm updates so you can quickly adjust your Technical SEO strategy accordingly.

By following the tips outlined in this Technical SEO 2022: Ultimate Guide, you will be able to optimize your website for better visibility in SERPs and get more value from your digital marketing efforts. So don’t wait any longer – start optimizing today!

What exactly is technical SEO?

Technical SEO is whatever you do to make it easier for search engines to crawl and index your website. Technical SEO, content strategy, and link-building tactics all work together to improve your sites’ search rankings.

On-Page SEO versus Off-Page SEO versus Technical SEO

Many individuals classify search engine optimization (SEO) into three categories: on-page SEO, off-page SEO, and technical SEO. Let’s quickly define each term.

On-Site SEO

On-page SEO refers to the information that informs search engines (and readers!) about the topic of your website, including image alt text, keyword usage, meta descriptions, H1 tags, URL naming, and internal linking. Because, well, everything is on your site, you have the most control over on-page SEO.

Off-Page SEO

Off-page SEO informs search engines of your page’s popularity and usefulness through votes of confidence, most notably backlinks, or links to your site from other sites. Quantity and quality of backlinks increase a page’s PageRank. A page with 100 relevant links from trustworthy sites will rank higher than a page with 50 relevant links from reliable sites, all other factors being equal (or 100 irrelevant links from credible sites.)

SEO Technical

Technical SEO is also within your control, but it is more difficult to learn because it is less obvious.

Why is technical SEO so valuable?

You may be tempted to disregard this aspect of SEO, yet it plays a significant impact in your organic traffic. Even if your material is the most comprehensive, valuable, and well-written on the web, very few people will ever see it if a search engine cannot crawl it.

It’s as if a tree fell in the forest while no one was present to hear it… Does it produce sound? Without a solid technical SEO basis, search engines will not value your content.

Let’s talk about how you can make your internet material popular.

Knowledge of Technical SEO

Technical SEO is a beast that is best digested in bite-sized chunks. If you’re like me, you prefer to tackle large tasks in sections and with a list. Believe it or not, everything we’ve discussed so far falls into one of five categories, each of which has its own set of actionable steps.

Technical SEO Audit Fundamentals

Prior to beginning your technical SEO audit, there are a few prerequisites that must be met.

Before proceeding with the remainder of your website assessment, let’s discuss these technical SEO basics.

Examine Your Favorite Domain

Your domain is the URL that users enter to visit your website, such as hubspot.com. Your website’s domain affects your discoverability via search engines and gives a consistent identifier for your site.

Conclusion

When you select a preferred domain, you indicate to search engines whether you like the www or non-www version of your site to appear in search results. You might, for instance, choose www.yourwebsite.com rather yourwebsite.com. This instructs search engines to favor the www version of your website and redirects all users to the specified URL. If not, search engines will consider these two versions to be distinct websites, resulting in dispersed SEO value.

title: Strategies Of Online Reputation Management
content:
For any kind of business, maintaining its reputation and consumer trust is vital for its survival and growth. Online reputation management has also gained importance in the current scenario. Imagine putting in efforts in your paid and unpaid marketing strategies and losing consumer trust due to bad reviews and malicious digital attacks. Nowadays, due to massive social media usage and online reviews, managing reputation becomes important to ensure sending the right message about your brand to your audience.

In this article, we will cover:

  1. What exactly is Online Reputation Management or ORM?
  2. Tools to manage ORM
  3. Strategies for proactive ORM

What exactly is Online Reputation Management or ORM?

Online Reputation Management actively monitors the conversations on digital platforms around your brand and addresses the negative discussions as soon as possible. This involves monitoring social comments, posts, and reviews concerning your brand. All these efforts are made with an aim to build a good brand image and reputation.

Here’s an interesting statistic about online reviews. According to Trustpilot, close to 89 per cent of consumers like to go through online reviews before arriving at a purchase decision. You certainly can’t ignore such a number.

There’s no doubt that online reviews hold a lot of importance for a business. This is because any kind of negative review left unaddressed can lead to a negative brand impression on the target audience. Any prospective consumer can come in contact with a negative review and change their decision.

At the same time, controlling a brand’s reputation online also involves ascertaining a clear brand message in the consumer’s mind. For instance, a handloom brand might want to portray itself as traditional, while a gaming brand might want to set a more friendly and modern approach. This message decides the kind of audience that a brand will ultimately attract.

More and more people are talking online about their brand experiences. In today’s tech-savvy world, it is essential to monitor the online conversations and events around your brand and reach your consumers first before they build any wrong impressions about you.

Tools to manage ORM

There are various tools that you can use as a business to manage the conversations about your business. Here are some of them:

Google Alerts

Google Alerts is a popular tool to keep a guard on your brand mentions online. It informs you about any new mention of your brand with the help of an email. It works with the help of the keywords that you choose. Google alerts will send you an alert when it comes in contact with your chosen set of keywords on any kind of online content like blogs, research articles, or posts.

Reputology

While it is easier to manage the customer reviews on your own platforms, managing them on different review sites and forums can be slightly tricky.

Reputology is a tool that makes it easier to monitor the online reviews around your brand. It sends you regular notifications about your brand reviews on review sites and forums. In this way, you can respond to them from a single platform. It also helps to understand how to actually respond to negative sentiments about your brand.

GatherUp

GatherUp is a tool that asks your consumers for a review of your brand. Positive reviews are a great reputation builder of a brand.

Moreover, reminding your consumers about the review will push your chances to get positive feedback that you can publish on your digital platforms.

Social Mention

Social Mention has different parameters based on which you can get a clear idea about your brand’s reputation. With the help of filters like language and location, you can find out the reviews, keywords, hashtags, and topics around your brand. Not only that, but this tool also gives a judgment of the possible feelings associated with a review, like a positive and negative review or a slightly neutral one.

Meltwater

Meltwater is an excellent tool to keep track of the activities involving your competitors. For instance, it lets you compare your brand reputation with your competitor and gives you insights into your competitor’s online mentions.

Strategies for proactive ORM

There are certain things that you should keep in mind while managing your brand’s online reputation.

React kindly

No matter the content of an online review or content, reacting to them kindly is essential to hit the right tone with your consumers. Nobody likes to hear a negative voice, and reacting to anything negative in an aggressive manner will make you come across as an arrogant brand.

Practice transparency.

There are human beings involved behind brands and it is impractical to expect perfection from human beings. Mistakes are natural but hiding these mistakes can do you more harm than good.

On the contrary, it is a good idea to address your faults and react to criticisms in a positive way. In this way, you can build consumer trust and loyalty.

React actively

Do not ignore or delay responding to the sentiments and reviews about your business, especially if they are negative. This can lead to a massive image wreck. It is essential to be quick on your feet and respond to criticism as promptly as possible.

Practice social listening

It is very difficult to improve yourself if you do not know your faults. With the help of social listening tools like HubSpot, you can understand what are people talking about you and form your reputation strategy accordingly.

Establish a blog

A blog is an excellent tool to form direct connections with your audience and interact with them. Blogs let you publish informative and useful content that is helpful to solving consumer problems. For example, a gifting business can publish blogs on gift ideas for different occasions. In this way, customers can trust your brand and interact with your content more often.

While you can’t always control what people talk about your business, it is possible to manage and track these conversations by investing in a good and structured online reputation management strategy.

title: What are E-Marketing strategies?
content:
You might have noticed the booming small businesses that are seeing growth even with small capital. How is that possible? Marketing techniques have come a long way from word-of-mouth and traditional media platforms to today’s digital platforms with efficient AI mechanisms. This efficient E-marketing with the help of AI and the internet is broadly defined as e-marketing.

In this article, we will discuss:

  1. What is e-marketing?
  2. Benefits of e-marketing.
  3. Types of e-marketing.

What is e-marketing?

E-marketing has many names like digital marketing, online marketing, and web marketing. This kind of marketing involves business promotion with the help of electronic devices and internet platforms.

How can marketing be left behind in a world where even monetary transactions have shifted to the digital world? Moreover, the benefits that come with online marketing are immense. The most special benefit being- real-time interaction with the target audience.

For instance, it is becoming more and more popular for brands to have a business account on social media platforms. Here they can post content and run targeted social media ads, which allows them to form real-time connections with their consumers. There are many ways of forming connections on the internet-comments, likes, views, and DMs- to name a few.

Benefits of e-marketing

The rapid and increasing popularity of e-marketing lies in the number of benefits that come with it. Here are some of them:

It is economical

For any kind of business, deciding the important expenses and allocating the capital is important. While marketing is an important business activity, spending a large amount of money on it can be difficult for businesses, especially small businesses.

This is the reason why e-marketing is opening new avenues for businesses. When compared with traditional media, e-marketing is much cheaper. Promotion can be easily done with the help of social media posts, ads, and email newsletters.

You can use the power of personalization

Running ads online is more effective due to the level of personalization that is possible online. You can decide the perfect target audience by filtering out users based on their demographics, interests, likes, and dislikes. This leads to better ROI on the ads as they are only shown to people who are likely to convert.

You can even analyze customer behavior on the internet and provide them with personalized offers and promo codes. A more personalized approach in marketing is more likely to earn customer loyalty.

Enjoy the benefit of increased reach

The current boom in internet usage and mobile phone users is great news for businesses around the world. It means reaching out to customers who might even be quite far away from your business location.

In addition, a brand can easily form connections over the internet and solve customer queries online. Customers can access the products 24/7 and make the purchase at their convenience with different payment options.

Social media is another way to reach more people and promote your business. It also gives you an opportunity to respond to customer queries and talk to them directly.

Types of e-marketing

There are different e-marketing tools that a brand can implement. You can choose these tools according to your business needs and future goals. Here are some of them:

Paid ads

The online world can bring in more views and users to your ads. With the help of paid ads, you can reach your consumers by running ads on search engines and platforms like LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram.

Google lets you run ads with the help of Google Adwords, where you have to bid on keywords. Once a user searches for these keywords, it will prompt the algorithm to show your ad.

Moreover, you can also set some conditions on the payment for these ads like cost-per-view, cost-per-thousand-impressions, or cost-per-action. In this way, you can ensure better ROI on your ads.

Influencer marketing

Influencer marketing gives a business the perfect opportunity to partner with an influencer according to their business type. Customer reviews, referrals, and influencer promotions are gaining popularity because people like to trust personal opinions.

For instance, a sportswear shop can partner with a fitness influencer to gain more consumers and form connections with the help of an influencer’s large-scale online followers.

Content marketing

With increasing online content consumption, it is no surprise that quality content production has become vital for brands. Nowadays, people are searching online for tutorials, queries, and issues that they face.

This is an opportunity for brands to earn customer trust by providing them with valuable content. It can be implemented with the help of informative blogs, videos, infographics, and emails.

When customers will interact with this kind of content, they will also be exposed to your business and will hopefully engage further.

Search engine optimization

Search engine optimization or SEO is when you optimize your business website to gain more audience along with the right kind of audience. With the help of several on and off-page SEO tricks, you can optimize your web pages and website for your users.

These SEO tricks ensure better visibility and include mobile optimization, increased speed, forming backlinks, and including internal links to your content.

Affiliate marketing

Affiliate marketing means marketing by paying a commission to external sources of traffic or conversion. An affiliate is essentially a link between the seller and the consumer.

Influencers, popular websites, and bloggers are some of the affiliate marketers that brands can approach for promotions. Affiliate marketers are paid according to pre-set conditions between the marketers and the brands.

This strategy is effective because it lets you promote your products and services on platforms that fall under your niche. For example, an art tutorial business can promote themselves via ads and links on a blog website that specifically talks about art. In this way, you can expect consumers with strong purchase intent since they are attracted by platforms of similar fields.

The online domain has certainly created more creative options for marketing for brands. Among so many different choices, a brand can choose the e-marketing strategies that align with their business goals and suit their interests.

title: Zero-cost Marketing Techniques
content:
As a small business, it is difficult or rather impractical to pluck out a huge chunk of capital to only spend on marketing. This is because there are a variety of costs that also need to be taken care of. Does that mean that there is no way to market at all? Is there no way to invest in marketing without money? It’s possible! And it’s possible because of a technique called zero-cost marketing.

In this article, we will talk about:

  1. What is zero-cost marketing?
  2. 9 zero-cost marketing techniques

What is zero-cost marketing?

A marketing plan that does not require any costs or expenses to be made is called zero-cost marketing. This technique is very popular among small businesses, although it is safe to say that big corporations also tend to make the most of zero-cost marketing.

Zero-cost marketing typically involves curating zero or negligible marketing techniques that can promote your products and create brand awareness. The Internet is one of the biggest mediums of this type of marketing strategy.

Zero-cost marketing also comes with its perks:

  • Helps you conduct a targeted marketing plan and focus on the right set of consumers.
  • Saves money that can be utilized on other aspects of the business.
  • Reach a wide set of audiences with zero or low levels of cost.

9 zero-cost marketing techniques

Once you think about it, you will be surprised at the amount of zero or low-cost marketing techniques that are out there. Here are some of them:

  • Use the power of social media

Social media has a plethora of free resources and options that can boost your business sales. It is one of the easiest and cost-efficient methods to start your marketing journey. One of the biggest advantages of social media platforms is the level of engagement and awareness that they can create.

Brands can easily build their personality over social media and target their potential customers. You can also run budget-friendly ads on apps like Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn that can be customized according to your target audience.

Not only startups and small businesses but also popular brands are investing time to build their social media personality and handles. With more and more unique tools, social media can be one of your biggest marketing strategies.

  • Hosting a webinar

The popularity of webinars has seen a gradual rise in the pandemic. If you can host a helpful and informative webinar, you can attract some loyal customers. Although a good webinar requires a focused plan, it is one of the best ways to reach a wider set of audiences and educate them about your brand.

Make sure to inform your target audience well in advance about the webinar that you are hosting. Opt for a topic that is either trending or that can solve any problem of your intended audience.

  • Invest in infographics

If there is one strategy that can make it easier to give out a lot of information in a fun and attractive way, it is infographics. Infographics are amazing marketing tools that can be used to create informative content and can be easily shared. All that is required is good researching skills and an attractive template.

With tools like Canva, you can create free infographics to post on your social platforms. If linked properly, infographics are known for attracting a good amount of traffic and engagement for your business.

  • Go for cross-promotion

Cross-promotion is like a barter system in some ways. Brands can approach related businesses for promotion and promote these businesses on their platforms in exchange.

Think about a digital marketing firm promoting a graphic designing business on their platform and vice-versa. This technique also helps to create industry relations along with a good reputation.

  • Focus on existing customers

Did you know that it is more expensive to sell to a new customer than an already existing customer? Acquiring customers is hard, but if you don’t invest time to retain these customers you can lose valuable customer loyalty and sales opportunities.

It is always a good idea to get feedback from your customers, act on the criticisms and inform them that you have worked on the feedback. A good connection with your existing customers will save you a whole lot of money.

  • Identify the right influencers

Influencer marketing is another technique that tends to be very effective. Influencers, as the name suggests, can create persuasive content for your brand and convince your customers on why they need your products.

Giveaways and contests are some of the popular influencer marketing strategies that are effective for both big and small brands. You can create a creative and well-planned campaign with the help of influencers that are related to your field. Discounts and promo codes can also be utilized to create a buzz around your brand.

  • Create your blog

Blogs are an effective way to form a connection with your customers and feed them information regularly. Not only do they drive traffic back to your website, but they also help your SEO and engagement levels by a vast margin.

You can use blogs to promote a new product, inform your audience about your business, or convince your customers about the benefits of your brand.

  • Use email campaigns

Emails are one of the most cost-efficient methods used by brands to talk to their target audience and consumers. Nowadays, with the help of email marketing tools, you can create free or cheap email marketing campaigns to send many emails at once.

Emails can be used to collect feedback, keep customers informed, and conduct surveys for your business.

  • Don’t neglect customer referral programs

Statistics reveal the power of word-of-mouth and recommendations. Referrals are a great way to strengthen your bond with existing consumers and at the same time gain new customers.

Many brands are adopting customer referral programs, where customers are given some rewards, free products, or loyalty points for referring the product to a friend or family member.

This technique is effective because it is easier to believe the experience of a known person than an elaborate advertisement.

author: Lukesh Pillaii

title: Why Should You Care About New Infographics Ideas ?
content:
Think about a simple document with information on SEO and an infographic filled with attractive virtual elements containing the same piece of information. Where will your eyes naturally take you? The human brain is naturally biased towards virtual pieces. As a result, you will find an infographic more memorable than a normal document. This ultimately means that if you want to target your intended audience with relevant information, infographics are one of the most ideal mediums.

In this article, we will go through:

  1. What are Infographics?
  2. Why do Infographics still matter in SEO?
  3. Can Google read infographics?
  4. What is infographic submission in SEO?
  5. How do you create an infographic rank?

What are Infographics?

An infographic is nothing but a piece of information strategically designed in an attractive manner with some virtual elements. In fact, the word ‘infographic’ is a portmanteau combining the words- ‘Information’ and ‘Graphics’.

Marketers have been using attractive infographics for link building and garnering traffic for quite some time now. This is because infographics can communicate boring or detailed data and information in a virtually attractive manner.

To put it briefly, infographics tend to use attractive fonts, bold colors, and illustrations to present the information in a simpler format- one that is also easily understandable.

Why do Infographics still matter in SEO?

Infographics come with their own set of benefits. That said, it is important to optimize them with SEO to get the most of these benefits. This is because infographics are one of the most popular marketing tools that can be used for link building. They are also easily shareable and help to attract more traffic.

One of the many benefits of infographics is the ability to easily share them on various social platforms like Google+, Pinterest, and Instagram. Just by adding social sharing buttons on your blog or website, you can be sure to increase the reach of these visually appealing pieces of content.

At the same time, the chances of fully optimized infographics are higher to show up in the Image search and the SERPs page. They can also be easily used to increase reach and engagement with the help of elements like likes and comments. These are among the various reasons why businesses are always on the lookout for better infographic ideas.

Can Google read Infographics?

It is important to understand that google can’t directly read any image or an infographic. That being said, there are ways in which Google can figure out the content and matter inside an image with the help of certain elements. Our job is to make it easier for search engines to understand our infographics by optimizing these elements. We will talk about these elements in the latter part of this article.

What is Infographic submission in SEO?

Infographics can be submitted on other websites to promote reach which is nothing but infographic submission in SEO. You can submit your infographics by following some simple steps.

  • Create a unique infographic

It is true that content matters. If your infographic is not helping to solve any problem of the intended audience, then there won’t be any conversion or engagement. Focus on your unique traits and create an infographic with unique elements and relevant content.

  • Include keywords

For optimizing any content for SEO, keywords play a major role. Research about the relevant keywords and include them in your infographic as well as every element connected with this infographic.

  • Focus on Submission websites

The next step is the research process. Research about the submission sites and consider their cost, domain authority as well as the kind of content that they post. All these elements will help you make the right decision about infographic submission.

Moreover, sites with no-follow links are excellent to target bloggers who might land up on your infographic and share them. Pinterest is one such site that can be targeted especially for good infographics.

How do you create an Infographic rank?

Building your website rank with the help of infographics is not a new trick. It can be done by optimizing the elements directly connected with the infographic.

  • Researching competition and Keywords

To build any good piece of content it is important to endure that it is what the audience wants to see. This ultimately means that it is ideal to conduct good competitor research to understand the kind of content your competitor is churning out. You should plan your content by keeping these topics in mind and investing in a good design.

Tools like Google Keyword Planner can be easily utilized to find out short and long-tailed keywords which can be included in the infographic.

  • URL

URL is one of the deciding factors that search engines use to show a result for a query. Make it a point to keep your URL short and relevant to the infographic and include one or two important keywords in it.

  • Filename

Filename adds identity to your content, so make sure to choose the correct name for your infographic. Avoid using generic filenames like infographic2.jpg instead, go for specific names connected with the content. For instance, if your infographic is about pollution trends in the year 2015, you can keep the file name as pollution-trends-2015.jpg.

  • ALT text

Suppose there are some issues in the loading process of your infographic. In such a situation an ALT text pops ups. This is usually for people who might be visually impaired. Always try to keep your ALT text as a brief one-line description of your infographic. If we take the above example again, the ALT text can be “Image on summarising the pollution trends in the year 2015”.

  • H1 Tag

Headings can also be used for SEO optimization by giving a proper title to your infographic.

  • Meta description

A meta description is the cluster of words that show up with links on the SERPs page. Always include all the important keywords and an accurate description of your infographic in your meta description.

  • Additional text

Additional text is mostly used as a hack to introduce your infographic to Google. This means writing a short introduction on your infographic before placing it on your website. This introduction should also contain relevant keywords for SEO optimization.

author: Lukesh Pillaii

title: Let’s Discuss About Intended Audience
content:
When you look at advertisements of brands like Nike and Netflix, have you noticed some peculiar differences? Like the tone, language, people who are featured in the ads, and even the style of advertising. Everything seems to be focused on different demographics of people that help to create a unique personality of each of these brands. Lets talk about Intended Audience

Venturing into anything whether business, content, or even marketing, requires one common factor- defining your audience. Without defining your intended audience you are just shooting arrows in the dark.

In this article, we will talk about:

Meaning of intended audience.
Intended audience in writing
Three different types of the intended audience
How can you make your copy more relevant?

Meaning of intended audience

In simple words, the intended audience is the set of people that your business or your content intends to interact with. It is an encompassed profile of the audience that your brand or copy would like to specifically target.

For example, think about this:
Suppose you are a business selling formal clothes and shoes. You regularly invest in running ads on social media, websites, and writing blogs. But, what if these ads or blogs also show up for people who don’t wear formal clothes or who are not at all related to the corporate world? What would that mean?

It would simply mean a waste of your resources since this group of people are less likely to buy your product. On the contrary, for optimizing your resources, rather than focusing on everybody, it is ideal to give your undivided attention to the relevant set of people.

Simply getting attention will not guarantee your brand success, you need to garner the right kind of attention from the right kind of people. This is the reason why it is important to identify your intended customers for more cost-efficiency and resourcefulness.

Intended audience in writing

When we consider a piece of content or copy, the overall tone and language of the piece create a huge impact. It would be very difficult to deliver your message across if you do not define your target.

For instance, If you are writing a message for children, using complex vocabulary and a serious tone will probably not help you deliver your message successfully. But, using the same for academics might be appropriate.

Good audience research and creating potential audience personas or profiles will also help you place relevant keywords in your copy for better engagement and reach.

Here’s how we can find our intended audience.

Find customer problems

Looking for customers with similar problems that your content can help solve is one of the first steps in identifying your target users. This helps you reach out to people who have a strong reason to read your copy and interact with it. For example, If you are a skincare brand, you can target people who are specifically searching for skincare solutions or talking about skin-related issues on various digital platforms.

Research your competitors

Inspiration is a valuable asset in the marketing domain. Invest time to identify your competitors and then identify the kind of audience that they target. Nowadays, with various social listening software, it becomes easier to compare and analyze the various strategies that your competitors tend to use for their copies.

Researching your audience

One of the most important steps would be to conduct thorough research of your target audience. This means understanding every aspect of their demographics like occupation, age, interests, goals, and location. After which, it will get easier for you to formulate tactics and strategies to incorporate in your copies and messages.

For example, using local slang or local vocabulary in your content.

Create a persona

How can you speak to your consumers without ever knowing them? Creating a persona or a prototype of your ideal consumers helps to solve this problem. Once you design profiles of the ideals customers, you will know their language, values, principles, income, education, and status.

This will help to look for answers for questions like:
How will a customer react to a certain tone in a copy?
How much information should you provide them with?
What are the topics that might interest them?

Three different types of Intended audiences

There can be a lot of segregations and groups but overall the intended audiences are divided into three main sections: Managerial, Experts, and Lay.

Managerial

The managerial audience type is more focused on content that will help them in the decision-making process. Graphs, data, and statistics are important tools to use here.

Lay

This set of the audience has no prior knowledge about the topic that you are discussing. This means that you have to emphasize and elaborate on terms and concepts more to explain in a better manner.

Experts

Also termed as a demanding set, the experts require maximum efforts. They expect elaborative visuals, graphs, and information. For experts, the vocabulary used is generally more on the technical terms and is more advanced.

How can you make your copy more relevant?

Clear headlines

It is common for a user to first glance through your headlines before they make a decision to actually read your content. This is enough to prove how important headlines are in a copy. Your headlines should always be brief, clear, and attractive for your users. On the other hand, using misleading headlines can hurt your conversion and engagement rate.

Using keywords

Once you understand your audience, using relevant keywords will help you reach them faster. Investing in keyword research is vital for an effective and engaging copy.

Your copy and headlines need to be SEO-friendly and with targetted keywords, otherwise, they might never reach your target audiences.

Get feedback

Regular feedback will help you grow and make your copy more relevant. Look for ways to gather constructive feedback from your consumers. This will help you understand their problems and improve your content immensely. It is also an excellent way to create more engagement opportunities between you and
